cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 225 mi E of Caibarien, Cuba and 380 mi SE of Miami, Florida

motion.direction: W (expected to resume WNW later today)

cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest along the north coast of Cuba, then turning northwest toward the Florida Keys and up the south-central Florida Peninsula
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Florida Keys / southern Florida Peninsula

port.name: Port of Palm Beach District, FL

weather_observation.under_warning: Hurricane Warning (also under Storm Surge Warning)
weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch north of Jupiter Inlet to Flagler/Volusia County Line; Storm Surge Watch north of Sebastian Inlet to Ponce Inlet
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Jupiter Inlet southward around the Florida peninsula to Bonita Beach (incl. Lake Okeechobee, Florida Bay, Keys); Storm Surge Warning Sebastian Inlet southward around the peninsula to Venice and the Florida Keys
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast Florida Atlantic coast from Sebastian Inlet south through the Keys, plus the southwest Florida coast as Irma turns northward
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (probability 92%) expected Saturday night, with hurricane-force gusts possible Sunday (64-kt probability 32%)
weather_observation.storm_surge: Storm surge 5–10 ft possible along the Palm Beach County coast during the Sunday morning high-tide cycle
weather_observation.rainfall: 10–15 inches, isolated 20 inches, could cause life-threatening flash flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; isolated tornadoes in outer rainbands
